reasoning: Acute bacterial infection caused by Salmonella typhi. WHO estimates global incidence of 16-33 million cases per year (mid-range ~20-24 million), translating to approximately 300 per 100k person-years. Incidence metric used (new cases, not existing cases). Extremely high geographic variation: endemic areas like South Asia experience 100+ per 100k, while developed countries with vaccination/sanitation <1 per 100k.
source: WHO Global Burden of Disease estimate (early 2000s)
